properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 9:35PM EST until February 14 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia...

Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Forsyth and Fulton Counties

Yellow River near East Lithonia affecting De Kalb and Rockdale
Counties

Yellow River near Conyers below Milstead affecting Newton and
Rockdale Counties

The Flood Warning continues for
The Big Creek near Alpharetta.
* From tonight until late Thursday night.
* At 845 PM Monday the stage was 6.8 feet, and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast to develop.
* Flood stage is 7 feet.
* The creek is forecast to rise above flood stage tonight and then
continue rising, reaching near 10.2 feet by Wednesday morning. The
creek is expected to fall below flood stage Thursday evening.
* At 7 feet, minor flooding of the woodlands and fields begins along
the creek between Cumming in Forsyth County, and Alpharetta and
Roswell in North Fulton County. Flooding starts to effect portions
of The Big Creek Greenway near Alpharetta and some portions may
become closed with around one foot of water, especially upstream and
downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill
Park. Portions of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will
begin to flood.

At 9 feet, minor flooding expands along the creek from near Cumming
to Alpharetta and Roswell. Backyards of homes off Seale Drive and
Gunter Court and portions of the Golf of Georgia begin to flood. The
Big Creek Greenway experiences significant flooding up to 3 feet
deep, which results in closure of most of the paths, especially
upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and
Rock Mill Park. A large portion of the YMCA Campground off Preston
Ridge Road will be under a foot of water.

At 10 feet, minor flooding expands along the creek from near Cumming
to Alpharetta and Roswell. Backyards of homes off Seale Drive and
Gunter Court and portions of the Golf of Georgia are under a foot of
water. The Big Creek Greenway experiences significant flooding up to
4 feet deep with closure of the paths, especially upstream and
downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and Rock Mill Park.
A large portion of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will
be under a two feet of water.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until late Thursday night
